page.title: 19TRADE IN TERLING
page.content: There are only two shops in the village, although a few years ago there was a third small shop near the windmill, serving the other end of the village. These two shops are both multi-purpose, the most central one in Crow Road being a Post Office cum General Store, selling food, hardware, stationery and some clothing. The second shop is the Off Licence, which also sells some groceries. The proprieter has a workshop adjoining the shop, where he repairs lawn-mowers and chain-saws. There is also a large public house here, officially named "The Rayleigh Arms", but commonly called "The Monkey". There are two mobile shops, also a paper round which serve the area. However, the majority of the villagers tend to shop in Chelmsford or Witham, especially since the hypermarkets have been built.
